item.title: Why Computers Can't Truly Roll the Dice
item.description:
The Casino’s Secret: Why Computers Can’t Truly Roll the Dice Ever wondered why casinos seem to have an unfair advantage? It’s not just the house edge; it’s also the technology behind their games. While computers are incredibly powerful, they have a secret: they’re not very good at randomness.

The Problem with Pseudo-Randomness

When you ask your computer to generate a random number, it doesn’t actually consult a cosmic dice roller. Instead, it uses something called a pseudo-random number generator (PRNG). Think of a PRNG as a magician with a secret trick: it appears to produce random numbers, but it’s actually following a predetermined pattern.
